In elit diam, iaculis a elit vel, sollicitudin ultricies magna. ::: ::: ::: g-col-4 ::: ::: ::: callout-tip This is a "tip" callout block. ::: ::: h2 Code and links (H2) ::: ::: body Code and link appearance inline: `ggplot()` and `geom_point()` require package `ggplot2`, which is available from [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/ggplot2/index.html). ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, colour = as.factor(Species))) + geom_point() + theme_classic() + theme(legend.position = "none") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](about_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){fig-align='center' width=672} ::: ::: ::: h3 Lists (H3 ::: ::: body 1. Is this an ordered list? 2. Who knows, honestly 3. I think so! ::: ::: h4 Different paragraphs (H4) ::: ::: body This text is in a "body" div. ::: This text is not. Any difference? ::: p This text is in a "p" div. ::: ::: h5 Would I even use this (H5) ::: ::: {.body style="background-color: pink; outline: 3px solid black; padding: 15px; margin-top: 2.5em;"} I'm also pretty sure that I can change the background/visuals of blocks quite easily. Not sure I'd want to do this much (as the callouts are pretty much the same thing) but it's cool to know. :::
